Add a column with height to GPS data

Source: R/append_height.R
append_height.Rd

Add a column named height to GPS data using a tif data as reference.

append_height(gps, heightfile)

Arguments

gps

A GPS data created from gtfs2gps().
heightfile

The pathname of a tif file with height data.

Value

The GPS data with a new column named height.

Examples

library(dplyr)

#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

fortaleza <- system.file("extdata/fortaleza.zip", package = "gtfs2gps")
srtmfile <- system.file("extdata/fortaleza-srtm.tif", package = "gtfs2gps")

gtfs <- read_gtfs(fortaleza) %>%
  filter_week_days() %>%
  filter_single_trip() %>%
  remove_invalid()

#> Reading 'agency.txt'
#> Reading 'routes.txt'
#> Reading 'stops.txt'
#> Reading 'stop_times.txt'
#> Reading 'shapes.txt'
#> Reading 'trips.txt'
#> Reading 'calendar.txt'

fortaleza_gps <- gtfs2gps(gtfs) %>% append_height(srtmfile)

#> Converting shapes to sf objects
#> Linking to GEOS 3.8.1, GDAL 3.1.4, PROJ 6.3.1
#> Processing the data
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘data.table’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:purrr’:
#> 
#>     transpose
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:dplyr’:
#> 
#>     between, first, last
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘magrittr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:purrr’:
#> 
#>     set_names
#> udunits database from /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/units/share/udunits/udunits2.xml
#> Shape 'shape836-I' has no snapped stops. Ignoring it.
#> 11 out of 12 shapes (91.67%) were properly processed.
#> 11 out of 12 trips (91.67%) were properly processed.
